availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alonzo Lokey (Brown Co, OH, shoemaker, saddler; pvt & 1st sgt KY 40th Inf and 4th Inf)

body.p: Brown County, Ohio, shoemaker, saddler, and soldier. Ohio native. Son of William Lokey and Mary E. Lokey. Shoemaker in Brown County, Ohio, in 1860. Saddler in 1864. Served in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private and first sergeant from September 29, 1863, to January 28, 1864. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private and first sergeant from March 24, 1864, to August 17, 1865. Prisoner of war at Lovejoyâ€™s Station, Georgia, from July 29, 1864, to April 1865. Paroled at Camp Chase, Ohio, in May 1865.
